acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.046mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the absence of mortality at the highest dose of 2,000mg/kg observed in the dermal studies with rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 2.7mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 595mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible in the absence of existing classification, though a slight increase in the incidence of hepatocellular adenoma was observed in rat 2-year carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.61 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 61-62degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutation tests, forward mutation assay, chromosome aberration tests, DNA repair tests and unscheduled DNA synthesis tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)). Also based on negative data on in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of abortion at doses inducing reduced body weight in parental animals in rabbit teratogenicity studies. Also based on the evidence of reduced fetal development and increased incidence of 14th rib anomalies at doses causing reduced body weight gains in parental animals in rat teratogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 61-62degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of moderate eye irritation (a mean Draize score of about 4) in rabbit eye irritation tests, with effects clearing after 72 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)): Non-irritating to the skin (Draize score: 0).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the evidence of sensitization observed in guinea pig Maximization tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including changed ALP/gamma-GTP levels, increased relative liver/kidney weight, and perilobular hypertrophy of hepatocytes (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including prone position, ataxia, bradypnea, reduced motor activity, loss of consciousness were found (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
